title: HD Intel 520 Display - mRemoteNG start but unable to stay in foreground
author: eck8tor
body_snippet:
After migrating to Windows 10 Enterprise version 1803 x64, mRemoteNG 1.76 start but can't use it because it's not accessible. 

If you click on it (when it's open) from the tab, it didn't come to foreground. 

If you do Win + Tab, you can see the application, you click to bring in foreground, it's appear an half second and going back in the background. 

You uninstall and delete display drivers and reboot to activate your change. The application is working perfectly.

@eck8tor Try to press Win+R, rightclick on the mRemoteNG-Window and select move > to desktop 1

comments.snippet:
It may be possible that the window has somehow moved off screen... If this is the case, try the following:

1. Open mRemoteNG
1. ctrl + right click on mRemoteNG in the taskbar
1. Use the arrow keys to move the window around - try starting with holding down the right arrow key (I've seen similar problems with other apps in the past, they tend to get stuck on the far left, so going right brings it back into view).
